From: "CYBERWOLF4" <cyberwolf4@...>

Did you forget again? I would like to know if you're dead yet so I can get
back to Norway.
----- Original Message -----
From: <cyberwolf4@...>
To: <nbwrpg@egroups.com>
Sent: Thursday, November 02, 2000 11:53 PM
Subject: Re: Wolf playing opossum


> IN his half wolf state Lunarpines repair systems continue to work.
> This fight was pushing his systems to the limits, as soon as one
> wound was healed another opened. Slayer seemed to know this. Pride
> seemed to be the only reason this fight continued. Lunarpine refused
> to lose. He wasn't losing fluid nearly as fast as Slayer so he knew
> that he could outlast the bot even if it caust Lunarpine his own
> life. He wanted to save Shadow Wing but not if it cost the rest of
> the maximals thier lives by giving the traitor the chance to live. If
> he left Slayer's weapons alone Slayer would continue fighting and
> Lunarpine would have the opportunity to finish him. He had a better
> idea though. he leapt forward again slashing both claws at Slayers
> shoulder cannons and biting for his neck. If he got a hold on him at
> close range this battle would be as good as over with Lunarpine the
> victor.
>
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, Yanshosh@a... wrote:
> > ::Slayer::
> >
> > Slayer continues to fly backwards, Lunarpine's slash leaving deep
> > gashes in his chest. He was losing mechfluid quicker and quicker..
> >
> > "Enough of this, Maximal," he says, sending another barrauge of
> > firepower at Lunarpine, "Die. I have other things to do than kill
> > you."
> >
> >
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > Lunarpine sees the opening he's created and leaps forward with a
> > > powerful slash from his right claw. his body takes abuse as he
> > > charges but the surge of adrenaline going through him drowns out
> > the
> > > pain. It was time to put an end to this battle and to the traitor
> > > once and for all. Lunarpine couldn't let the fact that they once
> > > served together matter. At this moment only two things mattered
> to
> > > him. Winning or losing would be the difference between who stands
> > > tall and who crawls away licking thier wounds.
> > >
> > >
> > > OOC Thank you and have a nice day.
>
>
>
>
>
